oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Embryonic Death & Early Abortion in Cattle: A Review
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Woelffer, E.A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Trichomoniasis
VIBRIOSIS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: To what extent do losses from early deaths occur? Reports range all the way from 2 per cent to 35 per cent. When a low level loss occurs in a large commercial herd, the situation may not always seem significant, however, if embryonic or early fetal death occurs in one or more valuable individuals, or the loss becomes a herd problem, the situation assumes considerable economic importance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1981; 108-112
